column4: I've download an .rpm package, used alien to convert it to .deb format, and now when I run "alien -d the/name/of/the/file.deb I get this error ->
trying to overwrite `/usr/share/man/man1/gaim.1.gz', which is also in package gaim-data
dpkg-deb: subprocess paste killed by signal (Broken pipe)
Why don't you just use the GAIM in the repositories?
oh, the package one?  -d is when you specify the path to the rpm file, not the deb file
alien -d converts a package that is in .rpm and converts it into .deb
right, you give it the path to the rpm, your paste has a .deb file in there.
in my own words, restricted is a free reserved software, right?
reserved as in reserved software that is used commonly.
eh?  restricted is stuff that isn't free but is supported
